data.description:
Process requests created by Vectra to either block or unblock the specified IP address on a Palo Alto Networks Firewall. If the detected device is a virtual machine and the request is to block the IP then a snapshot will be taken and a further check will be done to see if the virtual machine should be suspended.

Author: Chris Johnson

cells.block_code:
def on_start(container):
    phantom.debug('on_start() called')
    
    # call 'decision_1' block
    decision_1(container=container)

    return
cells.title: START

cells.connection_name: suspend vm, block ip, unblock ip
cells.title: END

cells.block_code:
def unblock_ip(action=None, success=None, container=None, results=None, handle=None, filtered_artifacts=None, filtered_results=None, custom_function=None, **kwargs):
    phantom.debug('unblock_ip() called')

    # collect data for 'unblock_ip' call
    container_data = phantom.collect2(container=container, datapath=['artifact:*.cef.dvc', 'artifact:*.id'])

    parameters = []
    
    # build parameters list for 'unblock_ip' call
    for container_item in container_data:
        if container_item[0]:
            parameters.append({
                'ip': container_item[0],
                'vsys': "vsys1",
                'is_source_address': True,
                # context (artifact id) is added to associate results with the artifact
                'context': {'artifact_id': container_item[1]},
            })

    phantom.act(action="unblock ip", parameters=parameters, assets=['pan'], name="unblock_ip")

    return
cells.description: Unblock the specified source IP address for the device.
cells.name: unblock ip
cells.notes: Unblock the specified source IP address for the device.
cells.title: Correct

cells.block_code:
def block_ip(action=None, success=None, container=None, results=None, handle=None, filtered_artifacts=None, filtered_results=None, custom_function=None, **kwargs):
    phantom.debug('block_ip() called')

    # collect data for 'block_ip' call
    container_data = phantom.collect2(container=container, datapath=['artifact:*.cef.dvc', 'artifact:*.id'])

    parameters = []
    
    # build parameters list for 'block_ip' call
    for container_item in container_data:
        if container_item[0]:
            parameters.append({
                'ip': container_item[0],
                'vsys': "vsys1",
                'is_source_address': True,
                # context (artifact id) is added to associate results with the artifact
                'context': {'artifact_id': container_item[1]},
            })

    phantom.act(action="block ip", parameters=parameters, assets=['pan'], name="block_ip")

    return
cells.description: Block the specified source IP address for the device.
cells.name: block ip
cells.notes: Block the specified source IP address for the device.
cells.title: Contain

cells.block_code:
def decision_2(action=None, success=None, container=None, results=None, handle=None, filtered_artifacts=None, filtered_results=None, custom_function=None, **kwargs):
    phantom.debug('decision_2() called')

    # check for 'if' condition 1
    matched = phantom.decision(
        container=container,
        conditions=[
            ["virtual", "in", "artifact:*.cef.cs1"],
        ])

    # call connected blocks if condition 1 matched
    if matched:
        snapshot_vm_1(action=action, success=success, container=container, results=results, handle=handle, custom_function=custom_function)
        return

    # call connected blocks for 'else' condition 2
    block_ip(action=action, success=success, container=container, results=results, handle=handle, custom_function=custom_function)

    return
cells.description: Use the custom string provided by Vectra to determine if the detected device is a virtual machine.
cells.name: decision
cells.notes: Use the custom string provided by Vectra to determine if the detected device is a virtual machine.

cells.description: Gather evidence for further analysis by taking a snapshot of the virtual machine's current state.
cells.name: snapshot vm
cells.notes: Gather evidence for further analysis by taking a snapshot of the virtual machine's current state.
cells.title: Generic

cells.block_code:
def decision_3(action=None, success=None, container=None, results=None, handle=None, filtered_artifacts=None, filtered_results=None, custom_function=None, **kwargs):
    phantom.debug('decision_3() called')

    # check for 'if' condition 1
    matched = phantom.decision(
        container=container,
        action_results=results,
        conditions=[
            ["artifact:*.cef.category", "==", "lateral"],
        ])

    # call connected blocks if condition 1 matched
    if matched:
        suspend_vm_1(action=action, success=success, container=container, results=results, handle=handle, custom_function=custom_function)
        return

    return
cells.description: Use the category provided by Vectra to determine if the detected threat has been categorized as lateral movement and needs to be stopped immediately.
cells.name: decision
cells.notes: Use the category provided by Vectra to determine if the detected threat has been categorized as lateral movement and needs to be stopped immediately.

cells.block_code:
def suspend_vm_1(action=None, success=None, container=None, results=None, handle=None, filtered_artifacts=None, filtered_results=None, custom_function=None, **kwargs):
    phantom.debug('suspend_vm_1() called')
        
    #phantom.debug('Action: {0} {1}'.format(action['name'], ('SUCCEEDED' if success else 'FAILED')))
    
    # collect data for 'suspend_vm_1' call
    results_data_1 = phantom.collect2(container=container, datapath=['snapshot_vm_1:action_result.parameter.vmx_path', 'snapshot_vm_1:action_result.parameter.context.artifact_id'], action_results=results)

    parameters = []
    
    # build parameters list for 'suspend_vm_1' call
    for results_item_1 in results_data_1:
        if results_item_1[0]:
            parameters.append({
                'download': False,
                'vmx_path': results_item_1[0],
                # context (artifact id) is added to associate results with the artifact
                'context': {'artifact_id': results_item_1[1]},
            })

    phantom.act(action="suspend vm", parameters=parameters, assets=['vmwarevsphere'], name="suspend_vm_1")

    return
cells.description: Immediately suspend the virtual machine to prevent further damage.
cells.name: suspend vm
cells.notes: Immediately suspend the virtual machine to prevent further damage.
cells.title: Contain

cells.block_code:
def decision_1(action=None, success=None, container=None, results=None, handle=None, filtered_artifacts=None, filtered_results=None, custom_function=None, **kwargs):
    phantom.debug('decision_1() called')
    
    source_data_identifier_value = container.get('source_data_identifier', None)
    source_data_identifier_value = container.get('source_data_identifier', None)

    # check for 'if' condition 1
    matched = phantom.decision(
        container=container,
        conditions=[
            ["vectra_block_request", "in", source_data_identifier_value],
        ])

    # call connected blocks if condition 1 matched
    if matched:
        decision_2(action=action, success=success, container=container, results=results, handle=handle, custom_function=custom_function)
        return

    # check for 'elif' condition 2
    matched = phantom.decision(
        container=container,
        conditions=[
            ["vectra_unblock_request", "in", source_data_identifier_value],
        ])

    # call connected blocks if condition 2 matched
    if matched:
        unblock_ip(action=action, success=success, container=container, results=results, handle=handle, custom_function=custom_function)
        return

    return
cells.description: Determine whether the Vectra request specifies a block or an unblock.
cells.name: decision
cells.notes: Determine whether the Vectra request specifies a block or an unblock.

data.notes:
This playbook uses the following Apps:
 - PAN Firewall (block ip, unblock ip) [asset name = pan_firewall] - blocks or unblocks the specified source IP address
 - VMWare vSphere (snapshot vm, suspend vm) [asset name = vmwarevsphere] - snapshot and suspend the detected virtual machine

Deployment notes:
 - This Playbook processes containers created by Vectra based on whether the created container has the source_data_identifier of "vectra_block_request" or "vectra_unblock_request". Containers with any other identifiers will be ignored.
 - The CEF custom string fields cef.cs1 and cef.cs2 are used to send the "virtual" tag and the VMX path of the VM, respectively
 - The custom cef.category field is used to categorize the threat. If the category is "lateral" it is considered higher priority and the virtual machine is suspended.
